1.text: Put on rubber gloves before working with dye.

2.text: Saturate a pair of opaque white tights with cool water from the tap.

3.text: Fill a medium-sized, stainless steel pot ⅓ of the way with water.

4.text: Set the pot over medium heat on your stovetop.

5.text: Pour 1 tenth of a standard synthetic dye bottle into the pot.

6.text: Stir the dye into the pot of water with a wooden spoon for 30 seconds.

7.text: Wring any excess water out of your tights until they’re not dripping wet.

8.text: Dip your tights leg-first into the dye solution.

9.text: Leave the leg and foot areas of the tights in the bath for 20 seconds.

10.text: Rinse off your lightly dyed tights in cool water for several seconds.

11.text: Wring out the tights to get rid of any extra water.

12.text: Pour 2 to 3 tablespoons (30 to 44 mL) of the same dye into the pot.

13.text: Place an empty pot to the left of the dye bath.

14.text: Set the upper and lower halves of your tights into different pots.

16.text: Pull 1 in (2.5 cm) of fabric out of the dye bath.

17.text: Pour 2 to 3 tablespoons (30 to 44 mL) of dye into the pot.

18.text: Wait 30 seconds before pulling out 1 in (2.5 cm) of the tights.

20.text: Add 2 to 3 tablespoons (30 to 44 mL) of dye into the bath.

21.text: Leave the feet and toes of the tights in the dye for 5-10 minutes.

22.text: Hold the tights under a cool tap and rinse them until the water runs clear.

23.text: Hand wash the dyed tights with warm water and gentle soap.

24.text: Rinse the washed tights under a cool tap to remove the soap.

25.text: Air-dry your garments for completely before wearing them.
